eGelUDbHNi3dAoho2mkTAQ.text: Easy to find a good variety of foods all day. Clean, cool, and open corner glass windows gives an airy feelings.

photos.caption: Photo of Food Republic - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Food Republic - Singapore, Singapore

yVEGbHJXaQfol5g98M_lNQ.text: I've been here a few times over the years and it's been consistent about two things: it's high price for honestly, pretty mediocre food. Tonight, was the final straw. A couple of friends and I were in a pinch and went in to grab a quick bite. My friend paid $9 for tofu, fish and rice from the (not so) econo-rice stall. I had the faux ayam penyet and veggie from Sumber Ayam ($9) and it made me sick. I went home and exploded from both ends. NEVER AGAIN!

photos.caption: Photo of Food Republic - Singapore, Singapore. looks can be deceiving. this $9 faux ayam penyet made me explode from both ends

8O-uMIE0XCBUDWtKlYCP6w.text: Limited selections of stalls only the popular staples like roast pork and chicken meals,assortment of noodles, Korean, Chinese and Japanese food.Nice decor. Air conditioning is a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Food Republic - Singapore, Singapore

W50Aquun4IE4aGmBLVVQWg.text: It's a Food Republic. So you know it's gonna be pricey. That being said, there are a couple of stalls I come back to. The yong tau food stall has old school soup properly brewed with soy beans so that the umami is there. I like that they separate the fried ngoh hiang on a plate for you without you having to ask. The roast meat stall is not cheap, but if you're a big eater, the twin roast set meal with dumpling soup and poached veggies is just the thing. It's about $12 but you can pick a combi of duck, char siew, roast pork or chicken. The dumplings are good - sturdy stuffing of meat with identifiable and reasonably sized shrimp and crunchy woodear in HK style. The Toastbox is like any other Toastbox and it has a good selection of egg tarts, probably targeting the office workers in the neighbourhood who pop by for tea. I'm always baffled by why everyone queues at the Toastbox for coffee. The drinks stall is also Toastbox owned and operated - hello? Food Republic owned by them? So you can skip the queue and get your coffee fix from the drinks stall too.

photos.caption: Photo of Food Republic - Singapore, Singapore. Quick breakfast

Vtzp_9-ee1POJaxi_Z7daA.text: Draws a touristy crowd who is willing to pay $7-$12 per meal.Hipster ambience. Food is good though.But you could always cross the road to SMU and go to the basement via any escalator. Walk to the food court at SMU. And pay half the price for your meal as you would at Food Republic.

photos.caption: Photo of Food Republic - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Food Republic - Singapore, Singapore

BmeTU5DXXb1I8eEdGs7vQw.text: Rather pricey food that has a certain standard-a meal here will easily set you back $6-$9. Love the atmosphere here as well as the variety of stalls (restaurants more like) including beef brisket king, Bangkok gem, a Japanese restaurant etc amongst others. Try the individual stalls to find out more!

photos.caption: Photo of Food Republic - Singapore, Singapore. Usual banana cake and yuanyang from toast box
Photo of Food Republic - Singapore, Singapore. Woo Lee Jeeb Dae Bak mixed vegetables stone pot rice ($7)
Photo of Food Republic - Singapore, Singapore. Thai milk tea!! ($3.90)

BSCl-ryRmKj9Ud1bt_lrOw.text: Another food court which seems to be the dining staple here.  Sumber ayam chicken rice was excellent -  got the fried chicken w rice.   Best chicken rice I've had so far in Singapore.  There is a Toast box in here.  Some of the vendor take credit card, some only take cash.  My sons like the beef noodle soup and the beef soup joint.

_hqL-icKnqWoiWjkpXU4og.text: I don't know why I'm reviewing a Food Republic food court except to say- don't bother when there's a ton of great food within a one block radius! Just walk down Waterloo street and head for the coffee shop down the road that has way better food and not at tourist prices. This Food Republic has air con and a Toast Box in it. That's all that's worth mentioning.

ELiZK-Ow98599046MPz1uw.text: Woh, the lady in the "duck rice" stall was so ... rude. Her attitude is like we go there to beg her for food. Their food was good though. But really bad service in that stall.
